summary:
Currently Director in a european defense/aerospace, I manage a team of 21 people, 11 nationalities spread over 2 main locations. I am also project manager of a few projects involving software development in tight schedules and budgets. 

I have worked before as software developer in the US Shuttle and International Space Station program.

I have no geographic limitation and business areas. I am mostly interested in Manned Spaceflight, software development, project/product/program management.

school.name: Sup’Aero, Ecole Nationale Supérieure de l’Aéronautique et de l’Espace

projects.title: MicroCarb Science Data Processing and Central Checkout System
projects.description: Project Management for the development and delivery of a science data processing tool, delivery of central checkout systems for the MicroCarb micro-satellite.

projects.title: OneWeb Central Checkout System
projects.description:
Project Management for the delivery to Airbus OneWeb Satellites a large amount of central checkout systems for the manufacturing of a large constellation of communication satellites.
Challenges went from handling a project at least 4 times bigger than any other project in the office's history, managing rapidly evolving requirements, to demanding delivery schedule.

projects.title: STAMP
projects.description:
Project Manager for STAMP, a data handling piece of software used in Satellites environmental tests. This software is a product constantly improved over the years with customer needs.
It used to be a one only customer project. I lead the proposal to gain a second customer (which we won) and since then have been getting increased interests by many other potential customers.

projects.title: Quantum Central Checkout System
projects.description:
Project Management for the development and delivery of the Quantum Satellite's Central Checkout Systems for Surrey Satellite Technology Ltd (SSTL).
In this project, the challenge was the short schedule required by the customer.

projects.title: Euclid Central Checkout System
projects.description:
Project Management for the development and delivery to Thales Alenia Space of Central Checkout Systems for the Euclid Satellite. 
I was initially Back-up Project Manager and trainer/advisor of the prime (and junior) Project Manager, then prime Project Manager from December 2015.
One of the challenges was the introduction for the first time in the company's projects of a new subcontractor from Romania with transfer of knowledge.

projects.title: Space Shuttle and International Space Station support software
projects.description:
RMS (Robotic Manipulating System) Situational Awareness Display (RSAD). Development and support for NASA of critical level 3 software that has been flying onboard the Space Shuttle since 1997 and the International Space Station (ISS) since 2001. This software guides astronauts manipulating a Robotic Arm. 

Responsibilities included:
· Software and math model algorithm development (Forward & inverse kinematics, path planning, etc.),
· Discussions between the team and the customers (Astronauts Office, Robotics Training Group, Shuttle Program),
· Validation processes for each release (every 2 or 3 flights) including testing within the frame of a Test plan document in NASA Simulation Facilities,
· Release submission, presentation and discussions of different issues with the Shuttle Program Control Board,
· Training support upon request including assistance on display meanings and usage,
· Technical assistance in case of a data or software source failure,
· Collection of feedback from the crew
· Mission support for each flight.

projects.title: The Virtual Astronaut learning tool
projects.description:
Designed and developed a learning tool (standalone or web-based) for NASA to promote education and public interest in space based research activities.
Main navigation environment involved developments in C++ and Virtools. Activities and games involved Flash actionscript programming.

profile_positions.description:
- Management of software projects team in NL involved in the development of Terma's Ground Segment Suite (tgss.terma.com) as well as the provision of Satellite Checkout turnkey solutions for Space primes. Responsibilities include recruitment, staff assessment, staff assignment, department budget and results responsibility, quality processes, etc.
- Projects monitoring and monthly reporting to higher management
- Participation and input to Business Unit strategy, cooperation with other Terma offices in projects and company strategy

- Operations Manager for Terma France, including management of 10 staff members based in Toulouse (mainly AIT and operations activities for Airbus, Airbus Oneweb, CNES, ESA), contract management and invoicing with customers, staff annual review, problem solving, Work council representation, legal proceedings wrt French labor law.
- Management of participation to Frame contract with CNES in the domqin of flight dynamics (Interface with consortium and CNES, proposals to restricted tenders
profile_positions.title: Director, Space Software Systems NL & FR

profile_positions.description:
Project Management from KickOff, design phase, implementation, testing acceptance, delivery to closeout. 
Recent projects include OneWeb CCS (Airbus OneWeb), Microcarb IEGSE (Airbus DS France), Sentinel5 UVNS EGSE (Siemens Austria), Quantum CCS (SSTL), Euclid CCS (TAS-I), Meteosat Third Generation (OHB), Sentinel4-ICCS (OHB), STAMP (ETS), STAMP (IABG), etc.

All projects procurement management

local IT infrastructure
Project Manager
profile_positions.title: Deputy to Director of Operations

profile_positions.description:
Automated Transfer Vehicle Control Center (ATV-CC):
- ATV-CC Simulator Operator of the ATV-Ground Control Simulator (AGCS) for ATV-CC Operational Qualification activities
- ATV Simulator (AGCS) administrator
- Training Instructor for ATV-CC Operational Qualification
- ATV System Validation Tests (SVT): Test Specifications, Procedures and Reports, Input and Participation to Non conformances Review Boards.
profile_positions.title: Simulator Operator and Simulator Officer, Training Instructor, Team Leader

profile_positions.description:
- Management of Terma ‘s project office in the Netherlands (14 people, 9 nationalities) including recruitment, staff assessment, staff assignment, monthly financial reporting, department budget and results responsibility, quality processes, etc.
- Management of hardware procurement for all projects including requests for quote, orders, supplier approval and quality approval follow up.
- Operations Manager for Terma France, including management of 7 staffs based in Toulouse (Airbus, Airbus Oneweb, CNES), contract management and invoicing with customers, staff annual review, problem solving
- Management of 2 to 3 medium size projects in parallel, including engineering phase (PDR, CDR), delivery and acceptance.
profile_positions.title: Department Manager

profile_positions.description:
Software development (C++):
- RSAD (RMS Situational Awareness Display), an application to support Astronauts onboard the Space Shuttle and International Space Station for the manipulation of robotic arm. Responsibilities included Development, rapid prototyping before and after astronaut's training, mission support at Mission Control Center's robotics' support room.
- to port the RSAD software described above to the windows pocket PC platform
- Shuttle arm Simulator for R&D and pre-testing of the RSAD software

Multimedia 3D web development using Virtools, C# and Flash actionscript for NASA to promote education and public interest in space based research activities (virtual astronaut website that is no longer)

Various Internal Research/Developments of applications using the latest technologies at the time in Virtual Reality (gloves, 3d Glasses, Virtools) in the environment of the International Space Station.
profile_positions.title: Systems Engineer (Software & Robotics)

profile_positions.company: NASA - National Aeronautics and Space Administration
profile_positions.description:
Graduate internship in the X38 department / Astronauts Office (partnership with Space Applications Services and European Space Agency). 
Man Machine interface design for the Crew Return Vehicle, development of display layout and symbology for the Reentry phase, implementation of a dynamic version for task oriented, evaluation by astronauts.
